channel.title: Posts on nowlin.io
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on nowlin.io

item.title: Reflections on Reading
item.description: For INFO 5410, I am instructed to respond to a series of prompts regarding my lifelong feelings, interests, and experiences with reading. I am offered a variety of options to submit my reflections, and I choose to submit a blog-style response. What do you remember about learning to read? How did you feel about books (e.g. intimidated, excited)? I remember loving the days during Kindergarten and First Grade when we would go through a Hooked-on Phonics set.

item.title: The Second Post - Testing
item.description: Test post number 2! Following codewithbubb’s tutorial Learning about Hugo categories, slugs, tags This is pretty annyoing.

item.title: First Post - The One-th Post
item.description: Welcome to nowlin.io v.3, created with Hugo! nowlin.io has endured many iterations, similar to reincarnation, except although it was neutral in regards to good/evil, it was afflicted with tortuous rebirts. Here is a brief history of my website. Domain bought via Google Domains in 2020, then launched via Google Sites. Google Domains was bought by Salespace, per Hacker News, prompting me to switch to Cloudflare for domain registration and self-hosting for, well, hosting.

item.title: Zeroth Post
item.description: Welcome to nowlin.io! This is the website of James Nowlin (me), Information Professional & Human Being. You’ll find a variety of content here, including an About section describing my site and me, a personal blog which has no parameters for content, and my eFolio for UNT’s MLS program. This page will evolve over time. Yee haw.
